Job Description

The Systems Engineer, Autonomous Support, will join the Vehicle Architecture and Systems Analysis team within the Embedded and Automotive Line of Business (LoB) Unit. As part of the team, you will work collaboratively with partners as they develop their Autonomous systems around Arm architecture. A competitive system solution will strike a fine balance between performance and power consumption. You will support partners in their own development to ensure they produce the most efficient system to optimize performance within a specified power and thermal budget.

Together with our dedicated team you will:
  • Work closely with Arm’s partners to ensure that their software runs best on Arm based systems.
  • Provide benchmark data to partners to allow comparison between Arm based systems and competition.
  • Collaborate with tools vendors, both internal and external, to ensure the eco system is in place to support partners.
  • Identify areas for potential improvement in both Autonomous software and hardware.
  • Collaborate with IP design teams in Arm and with external partners to improve Arm-based products.

Job Requirements

What skills, experience, and qualifications do I need?
  • Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer engineering, or in a related field
  • Minimum 5 years of experience developing software architecture, requirements and specifications for complex systems
  • Experience and understanding in Arm architecture, RTOS, Operating systems, SoC architecture, System architecture
  • Deep understanding on Linux internals as well good working knowledge of compilation tools (DS5, Arm Compiler 6, GCC, IAR, Greenhills)
  • Fluent with C/C++ programming and scripting (e.g. Python)
  • Experience with compilation tools and debugging issues with the source code
Desirable skills:
  • Knowledge of Arm processor architecture
  • Experience with setting up servers, applications, and tuning application performance
  • Knowledge of performance analysis tools and methodologies
  • High-level knowledge of computer architecture including translation, caching, IO devices, DRAM, etc. ...
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Dedicated and self-motivatedWillingness to be flexible and accept new challenges
  • Excellent written and oral interpersonal skills

About Arm

Arm® technology is at the heart of a computing and connectivity revolution that is transforming the way people live and businesses operate. From the unmissable to the invisible; our advanced, energy-efficient processor designs are enabling the intelligence in 86 billion silicon chips and securely powering products from the sensor to the smartphone to the supercomputer. With more than 1,000 technology partners including the world’s most famous business and consumer brands, we are driving Arm innovation into all areas compute is happening inside the chip, the network and the cloud.

With offices around the world, Arm is a diverse community of dedicated, innovative and highly talented professionals. By enabling an inclusive, meritocratic and open workplace where all our people can grow and succeed, we encourage our people to share their unique contributions to Arm's success in the global marketplace.
